intro: Hyphipus trigona, commonly known as the three-angled hyphipus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. Hyphipus trigona is often found in woodland or rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in relatively dry conditions.
